attributes.action: All products with gelatine must be labelled clearly,animal or vegetable gelatine
attributes.background: There are many products on the market which contain gelatine. Gelatine is found in our foods, sweets and in our pharmaceutical products,these are just a few examples. Clear labelling on EVERY product that contains gelatine and what type of gelatine it is, be it from animals or vegetables.

attributes.action: The government should rethink its policies towards international students.
attributes.background:
A recent study* has shown that International Students make a net contribution of Â£2.3bn a year to the UK economy in London alone, as well as enhancing the UK's soft power globally.

However, the IPPR** claim current policy causes "unnecessary harm" to the UK's international education sector.
attributes.additional_details:
The IPPR*** make the following recommendations:
1. Students should be excluded from the drive to reduce net migration to tens of thousands.
2. The UK should set out a 10-year plan for expanding its international education sector.
3. The government should extend post-study work opportunities for international students.
4. Data collection methods should be improved to enable more robust assessment of migration patterns of international students.

* goo.gl/cT9o57
** goo.gl/R7Y8q3
*** goo.gl/7Nk9Vk

attributes.action: Making it easier for adults to be diagnosed with autism
attributes.background: Having been diagnosed with autism in my adult life, which was not easy to do, I want to help adults get help being diagnosed a lot easier

attributes.action: Organise better system at Dartford Toll. Delays of at least 2 hours unacceptable
attributes.background: I have been using this route for over 30 years and never experienced the delays as I am now, since removing the tolls. Something MUST be dine
attributes.additional_details: It does not matter what time of the day I leave my home in East Sussex, I am delayed for at least 1 and half hours - why??

attributes.action: Take action against France for enforcing the Burkini ban
attributes.background: The Burkini is a full body Swimsuit which covers everything apart from the face, feet and hands. So far authorities in 15 French towns have banned the wearing of Burkinis following completely unrelated terrorist attacks.
attributes.additional_details:
The Burkini enables women who wish to cover their bodies access to beaches and public spaces. The wearing of the outfit is completely unrelated to the attacks carried out against France. We feel that the Burkini ban infringes on women's freedom to access public spaces and to wear what they desire. The burkini ban also goes against the UDHR (Universal Declaration of Human Rights). 
We urge the British government to advise the French government to seriously reconsider the ban on Burkinis.

attributes.action: Personally apologise to HM Forces personnel dismissed due to their sexuality.
attributes.background:
Thousands of serving gay military personnel suffered intrusive investigations into their sexuality, losing homes, careers and friends. Many faced homelessness, rejection and no suitable alternative career. Many experience unemployment and poor mental health, even now.
We demand a personal apology.
attributes.additional_details:
Not one individual subjected to investigation and dismissal from HM Forces, has ever received an apology. 
In 2007, the MOD provided a watery statement of recognition, but  many didn't know about it and it certainly wasn't personal. 
There is a moral obligation to apologise for this treatment. The effects of these investigations are still very real for these people.
Given the law in this area was only repealed in the 2016 revision of the Armed Forces Bill, the time is right to apologise.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for farmers and food producers to use antibiotics routinely.
attributes.background: Antibiotic resistance is a major health problem. Much is caused by routine feeding or injecting of livestock to improve yields. This has stopped many antibiotics from working causing dangerous patient health issues and increased NHS costs. This resistance threatens ALL antibiotic effectiveness.
attributes.additional_details: While there might be occasions when farm animals need antibiotics to treat specific illnesses, the wholesale use can only increase the risk of the evolution of resistant bacterial strains with fatal human consequences.

attributes.action: Improve the morale of NHS working staff by reducing the disparity in wages
attributes.background: The morale of the working staff in the NHS is at an all time low ebb. So it's no surprise that they take little pleasure in going to work, and that enthusiasm is lacking. A committee is needed to balance the difference in wages and working conditions between the different tiers of the hierarchy.
attributes.additional_details: I have had firsthand experience in this matter, visiting hospitals once a month for the last 10 years for treatment. After speaking to numerous members of the nursing staff, it became apparent that a large majority were unhappy with the working conditions and the difference in pay between themselves and more senior doctors in the NHS. I wish for this matter to be discussed, and for the balancing of wages to be considered by a committee.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to protest at an equality event or celebration
attributes.background:
Events that celebrate or try to raise awareness of equality issues In the UK should be safe places. 
If you attend a pride or rally, you shouldn't have to face people who are protesting against your human rights & entitlements.
Protesting (even peacefully) at these events should be an offence!
attributes.additional_details:
Equality is for everybody. 
I agree that all are entitled to an opinion but an opinion that affects somebody's rights should be kept to yourself. 

People who are celebrating, I.e. Gay pride, deserve to feel safe & to be in a non-judgemental environment at these events. With protesters there, you often find arguments start, abuse & threats are often directed at those celebrating. 


Humans rights are for everyone, regardless of any factor.

attributes.action: Create a train line along M25 with train stations near each junction.
attributes.background: M25 is a nightmare for commuters especially during peak hours. Commuters waste precious time sitting in long traffic queues around the  junctions such as J27, J21, J16, J15, J12 and Dartford crossing. Traffic on M25 is also adding to vehicular pollution.
attributes.additional_details: Creating a train line along M25 with train stations near each junction would ease the traffic on M25 and reduce vehicular pollution. This outer circle can then connect to all major train line that go into the Central London areas or going to other areas of the Country. Ample parking in these train stations will allow commuters to drive into the nearest station and hop onto trains. Local businesses around the train station will also benefit from the new investment.

attributes.action: Train more doctors.
attributes.background: To meet future demands for healthcare, whilst managing the hours worked by doctors, we need more doctors.  There are currently lots of talented people who want to train as doctors but can't because there are not enough places at medical schools.
attributes.additional_details: As well as increasing the number of training places available to people aged 18, the number of places available to people in their 20's (both with and without a first degree in another subject) should be significantly increased to improve access to medicine as a career.  Currently to secure a place at medical school you have to demonstate an excellent academic record, a committment to medicine and a track record of helping others, usually by the age of 17.

attributes.action: Impose restrictions on corner shops / off-licence shops using plastic bags.
attributes.background: We saw clear decline of using plastic bags after imposing 5p charge which benefit the environment a great deal. It is time to impose restrictions or small charge on corner shops / takeaways /  off-licence shops  etc.This will further cut out the mess on our streets and will benefit small business

attributes.action: Have a minimum age of 12 years old before having a body piercing.
attributes.background: Babies and toddlers often have their ears pierced because their parents think it will look nice. It causes the child pain and puts them at risk of infection. It should be left to the individual as to whether they wish to have holes made through their own skin when they are old enough to understand.

attributes.action: Make fast food, take aways & restaurants clearly lable items containing alcohol
attributes.background:
All take away, Fast food and restaurants in the UK should have clear labels warning consumers about hidden alcohol in food.
People who don't consume alcohol for religious reasons and parents are unaware alcohol is being consumed when they eat certain products from food outlets.
attributes.additional_details: When I ate in wasabi today I asked if the sushi contained alcohol, I was told the sushi and curries contain alcohol and it's up to the consumer to ask the ingredients they shouldn't have to make people aware of the alcohol in the food. Mortified my child had just eaten the food, I was told it was my fault for not checking before hand. It's time to label food containing alcohol clearly.

attributes.action: Debate changes in child welfare law and update the guidelines
attributes.background: Legislation regarding child welfare and guidelines social work departments work under are outdated. And leaving children vulnerable and at risk.. The law needs updating and quickly, specifically sections related to child abuse verbally abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
I am calling for the law on child neglect, written in 1933, to be overhauled to protect children from being badly fed, left alone at home, not educated or belittled and bullied by their parents.

The 1933 law requires that a child is physically harmed or injured before charges can be brought, yet child neglect is the most common form of maltreatment. It is suggested that around 1.5 million children are affected.

attributes.action: Allow all alternative milks on the school milk scheme for allergy sufferers
attributes.background: Currently the milk scheme in schools allows cows milk, lactose free milk, goats milk and sheep milk which are not suitable for children who have a dairy allergy. I feel that a child shouldn't be excluded from having milk, this is preventing them from much needed nutrients and are being singled out
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see the scheme offer alternative milks which are suitable for children with allergies such as almond, oat or coconut. Another alternative would be soya, however, this isn't suitable for all children with a dairy allergy.  This would then allow all children to have the milk they should be entitled to. Milk is very important for any child and they shouldn't have the opportunity taken away from them just because they have a dairy allergy.

attributes.action: Free school transport for primary schools and high schools
attributes.background: Costs of travelling to school everyday add ups and parents struggle to pay for it. Also, the safety of the children is at risk of getting kidnapped or killed due to having to walk miles to school alone and/or on busy roads.

attributes.action: Make bonfires a criminal offence except on 5 November and the nearest weekend
attributes.background: Bonfires are environmentally unfriendly and pollute the houses, gardens and washing of the people nearest to it. This can be a considerable radius depending on the atmospheric conditions. It is unacceptable for people to have to close their windows - whatever the weather - to keep smoke out.

attributes.action: If UK weather reaches 30degrees people should get sent home from work on pay.
attributes.background:
Comfortable working environment.
To hot to work indoors. I.e factory's etc or any buildingwith broken aircon or without any Aircon.
attributes.additional_details:
UK workers.
Factory's,call centers etc or any other place with no aircon facilities.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to use national flags for party political purposes.
attributes.background: National symbols, e.g. the Union Jack and St George's Cross, are often used by political parties wishing to add legitimacy to their views. This means that symbols that should represent everyone, regardless of politics, ethnicity or religion, have become linked to particular political agendas.

attributes.action: I want the government to recognise  severe neuropathy as a disability
attributes.background: Neuropathy is a extremely painful progressive disease. Nothing can cure it,there is only treatment for the pain.It usually starts in the feet,then hands but eventually affects the whole body

attributes.action: Allow all people with terminal conditions access to trial drugs.
attributes.background: Developing drugs is a lengthy process. When drugs first display effectiveness, the path to approval for use is a long one, to ensure the benefits outweigh any potential risks. But nothing is more risky than death and the terminally ill may be denied potentially life saving treatments in this wait.
attributes.additional_details: The current process of drug development for the terminally ill leaves patients with little power or hope. It feels like what the patient wants is being ignored. In some cases drugs are denied from the rest of the patient population for years after being shown to save lives in the condition, allowing avoidable death on a massive scale. There are many terminal conditions that share this frustration affecting adults and children and babies. Everyone should have the right to the best chance to live.

attributes.action: Fully-fund all disabled veteran British service people and their families.
attributes.background: For too long, the RBL Poppy Appeal and HFH charities subsidies care and support given to disabled returned service people and their families. Taxation is being squandered on Trident when the real cost has already been incurred. It is morally wrong to depend on charity. It's the government's duty.
attributes.additional_details:
1/ The amount spent on Trident is obscene.
2/ The shameful shortfall required to barely fund care and support currently is being topped up by charities. Without it they would be even worse off. 
3/ It's been going on for too long.
4/ The Government has all the stats. What they need is the guts and moral stamina to take care of our fallen. Fully.
5/ The Poppy has become a symbol of successive Government's failure to care for our damaged service people and their families.
6/ It's our moral duty.

attributes.action: Use motorway matrix signs to say "Keep left unless overtaking."
attributes.background: This could be used where appropriate to remind drivers that are driving in centre lanes to move over. Thus helping traffic flow.

attributes.action: Hold General Election once a Tory leader's found & before Artcle 50 is triggered
attributes.background: The U.K. Government should represent the people of the U.K.  Following the recent referendum both major parties at Westminster have seemingly imploded. Once new party leaders have been found the UK should decide who is right to govern them.
attributes.additional_details: This should also be done before Article 50 is invoked so that the Prime Minister leading the negotiations has the backing of the people

attributes.action: Reduce corporation tax to less than 12.5% give companies a reason to stay in UK
attributes.background: Post Brexit vote we need immediate action from the government as many companies will already be planning to leave the UK. Time is of the essence and we need to halt a mass exodus of  businesses and secure jobs for Britain. In-party politics should take second place to measures such as this.

attributes.action: Allow HM Armed forces to be able to vote at their current base UK or worldwide.
attributes.background: Due to the busy and unpredictable nature of their jobs Service personnel have found it difficult to vote in person or by post/proxy and often don't get to have their say on matters and the things that ultimately effect their careers, families and their country they are proud to serve.

attributes.action: Ban tenant renewal fees
attributes.background: Why should we, the tenants, or even the landlords, have to pay out an extreme amount of money just for estate agents to print out the exact same paper as they did before, with just a couple of numbers changed? I SAY NO!
attributes.additional_details:
This world is hard enough you love in with all the prices on rent, bill, shopping etc, increasing all the time.
Estate agents make enough money from us.
It's extortionate for them to request more money for then to do absolutely nothing other than print out a bit of paper.
Anyone can do this.

That money being requested could go towards a lot of things you need.
DON'T let them keep doing this to you.
DON'T let them rip you off!!
Sign now, and let's fight back to take what is OURS!!

attributes.action: For ALL EU Protected Sites & Species to carry on being so even if not in the EU
attributes.background: We have various species and sites in the UK that are currently protected by EU law.  We must ensure that these continue to be protected within the UK even if we are no longer part of the European Union due to the result of the recent democratic vote.
attributes.additional_details:
A few links to various species and sites that are currently protected: 
http://jncc.defra.gov.uk/page-1747
https://www.gov.uk/topic/environmental-management/wildlife-habitat-conservation

attributes.action: Verify the quantum of EU Referendum votes made on the basis of lies & untruths
attributes.background: The 23 June 2016 EU Referendum, has set a path for the UK which is likely to cause significant damage to the economy and send the UK into recession. It has emerged that many voters cast their votes on the basis of lies, untruths and misrepresentation of facts by both the Leave & Remain campaigns.
attributes.additional_details:
Following the Leave and Remain Campaigns backtracking on the various promises and statements that they made to the electorate,  the leading polling consultants have now determined that many voters cast their votes on the basis of these claims that have now been proven to be lies and untruths and many voters have confirmed they would now cast their votes differently.

The Government needs to determine if this sample is statistically relevant and if it could have affected the outcome of the result

attributes.action: CHANGE THE LAW TO PROTECT ANIMALS FROM THREATS OF VIOLENCE AND DEATH FROM PEOPLE
attributes.background: Animal protection laws need to be change so it become illegal for people to threaten to kill someones animals.
attributes.additional_details: As it stands at the moment it is not a criminal offence to tell people that they will kill your animals and they can get away with with completely until they have caused harm to the animal. We need to have this changed so that people will get some kind of criminal conviction for threatening peoples animals.

attributes.action: Brexit negotiations to promote a strong & collaborative relationship with the EU
attributes.background: Sixteen million people voted to Remain. The views of these people and the weight of their opinion must be reflected in Brexit negotiations. The negotiation team must focus on forging a strong, collaborative and balanced working relationship with the EU, and be made up accordingly.
attributes.additional_details:
I was vehemently for Remain, and now I am determined that Brexit is made to mean healthy collaboration with the EU on new terms (and terms that the Northern Ireland and Scotland can support as part of the UK) rather than a soapbox for nationalistic rhetoric!

Britain may have voted out, but it clearly and emphatically does not want away. Most importantly, Brexit does not (and will not) mean embracing the Farage and Le Pen view of the world!

It is hope the EU will help us make this happen.

attributes.action: To review spent criminal convictions on a dbs after 10 years have elapsed.
attributes.background:
I was convicted 15 years ago of possession with intent to supply cannabis. 
I served my community service order and have never or will never re-offend.
The problem I have know is this will always show on a dbs disclosure and has stopped me, in some cases having a good career.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst I understand certain convictions should remain on a dbs disclosure permanently, my view is that a lot of people deserve a bona fide second chance. 
A wiping of the slate clean so to speak. I don't want myself and probably many others to keep on getting refused the chance to do better for themselves and their families because of a mistake they've made many years ago and have properly rehabilitated from. 
I urge the government to seriously consider this and let genuinely remorseful people move on.

attributes.action: now that the British people have voted , we need an updated  magna carta
attributes.background: now that the British people have voted to leave the eu, one of the wrongs needs to be righted, a British bill of rights is needed to include an updated people's magna Carta to include the original laws but updated for the 21st century, also if possible to be signed &  agreed by the head of state
attributes.additional_details: the magna Carta was signed by the then head of state king John, to protect the people's rights for lawful imgresses, parts of the laws were watered down or revoked by various people over the centuries, therefore losing said rights, but some still stand as of today & as this was the peoples choice to leave the eu, those in charge, parliment etc, should now be held accountable by the said people as/if the  need arises

attributes.action: Define rights of EU citizens currently living in Britain after leaving the EU
attributes.background:
There are many EU citizens who have been living and working in Britain for many years, and built lives here

Once Clause 50 is enacted, nothing will definite their status.
However, the British Parliament can define immediately what rights these people have once we are no longer in the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
Some EU citizens have lived here for decades, worked, paid taxes, and contributed to the British Economy.
No timeline has been given by Parliament to start, and it can take up to two years to complete
It is unfair to expect tax paying people to endure this period of uncertainty in their lives.  This decision does not need to wait for EU negotiations to begin, or await a new prime minister â it can be enacted with immediate effect, as this right will be the responsibility of the British People

attributes.action: Create a multi-party team to negotiate the exit from the EU including MYPs
attributes.background: The exit from the EU has a long term impact. MYPs (youth parliamentarians) should be included in a new multi party team that leads the exit rather than the leader of the largest party in Westminster. This team needs to reflect the views and background of the nation as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: There are 12 different political parties with MPs in Westminster. There are 369 MYPs. The young have the most to lose from a poorly negotiated exit. Let's ensure a democratically representative task force, including all parties and elected young people leads the exit process. This will avoid the exit being led by a team with an unrepresentative perspective on what we in the UK want. This gives us a chance at getting the democracy in the UK that we deserve.

attributes.action: We need a Government of National Unity elected by Proportional Representation.
attributes.background: Solving the EU withdrawal problems will require help from the best of politicians, regardless of their political persuasions. With Proportional Representation every vote will again count and every voter's interest will be protected.

attributes.action: European Union Referendum, 75% Required
attributes.background: Call upon HM Government to implement a rule that if the Remain or Leave vote is less than 75% then the Referendum Vote to Remain or to Leave the European Union is conducted again, until we reach 3/4 of the United Kingdom agreeing to either Remain or to Leave the European Union.

attributes.action: Not to invoke Article 50 until the year 2026.
attributes.background:
Leaving the EU because a political party used the promise of an in out referendum on our European membership as an electoral bribe was both ethically and morally wrong. 
For this, and many other reasons, I feel that a prolonged period of reflection is needed before Article 50 is invoked.

attributes.action: Raise the age of voting to 25
attributes.background: It would appear that too many young people between the ages of 18 and 25 are being persuaded about their political decisions by uneducated pop stars and celebrities. therefore only persons over 25 should have the political mandate.
attributes.additional_details:
Bob Geldorf, had a few hit records and now extols the advantages of remaining in the EU. With no expertise in how the EU works or any political office of his own. is also not a British citizen

Bono, had some hit records and now extols the advantages of remaining in the EU. With no expertise in how the EU works or any political office of his own. is also not a British citizen

attributes.action: Give UK citizenship to all migrants living in the UK on the 23rd June 2016.
attributes.background: Let's start the UK's move to full sovereignity with a promise to migrants, both EU and otherwise,  that they will be entitled to full citizenship if they were registered as living in the UK on the 23rd of June 2016.

attributes.action: Create further protection for the UK's Human Rights Act of 1998
attributes.background: The UK's legal human rights are formed from the Human Rights Act of 1998, and was protected informally by our membership of the EU. It is now possible future governments will adapt or remove UK citizens human rights easily if no protection through a 2/3rds parliamentary majority is created.
attributes.additional_details:
The following explains how the Human Rights Act protects rights we all assume we have:

https://www.liberty-human-rights.org.uk/human-rights/what-are-human-rights/human-rights-act

And evidence of considerations to remove the act by members of the Government:

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/scrapping-the-human-rights-act-will-help-protect-human-rights-attorney-general-says-a6894966.html

Do not allow your rights as individuals in the UK to be lost because the UK has left the EU.

attributes.action: In future votes ballot slip to carry a warning that once cast the vote is final
attributes.background: After the Brexit vote and stories in the press that people voted out/remain as a protest and now wish to change their vote ballot slips should carry a warning that once placed in the ballot box your vote is final and can not be changed
attributes.additional_details: Also people should be made aware that in a democratic voting process when one side should win more votes than the other no matter how slim the margin the side with the most votes wins and there is no option to rerun the vote

attributes.action: Let Bristol & London remain in the EU following a majority in the referendum
attributes.background: Following on from the EU referendum, Bristol & London both had an overwhelming majority vote to remain with Bristol at 62% & London at 73.5%. They should therefore be allowed to remain in the EU governed as separate county states by local government.

attributes.action: Allow the area within the M25 to secede from the UK and remain part of the EU.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe the results of the EU referendum highlight irreconcilable differences between those living within the M25 and those outside of it.  Accordingly, we wish to secede from the UK so that we can have our (sane) vote to remain part of the EU respected.
attributes.additional_details: We invite those areas of the UK that voted to remain to join us and become part of a new commonwealth of the enlightened.

attributes.action: Create an independent City State of London & the surrounding areas.
attributes.background: Due to the recent European Referendum result, it's apparent that London has a significantly different outlook in regards to the rest of the world. We therefore wish for London to break away from the UK and become an independent, sovereign nation.

attributes.action: I would like you to ban birds that are kept in cages.
attributes.background: I would like to ban people from selling and buying birds as pets and keeping them in cages as I think it is very cruel for them to spend their lifetime in a cage and not being able to fly freely like they should do. Birds are born to fly and don't deserve a life like this...

attributes.action: No confidence in the Government's Naval Strategy
attributes.background:
The Government should increase the effectiveness of the Royal Navy by designing and building the fleet into a credible and efficient navy by reducing the colossal waste and inefficiency in defence procurement.
We need to change the Royal Navy into an effective navy that can be fit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
We the undersigned via this petition wish to show our dismay with the Governmentâs naval strategy, caused by underfunding, resulting in new ships unfit for purpose, delays in building the Type 26 Frigate and overspends on other projects.
More money should be allocated to the naval budget by reducing the amount spent on foreign aidâ

attributes.action: An electronic voting system needs bringing in.
attributes.background: By moving forward from the outdated paper-based voting system you will squash a lot of the rumours of a rigged election as many people do not trust the governing body. I know many people who do not vote because they believe that their votes are essentially changed due to having to use a pencil.
attributes.additional_details: Not only would an updated voting system be a step in the right direction but also it wood make our country look better and more fair. People may also be able to trust an electronic voting system more than the current paper-based one.

attributes.action: Introduce retrospective legislation offering protection to company pension funds
attributes.background: Philip Green purchased BHS in 2000. Since then he has reportedly extracted Â£580M from the company, driving it to bankruptcy. Meanwhile there is a Â£571M shortfall in the pension fund affecting thousands of workers. This is a morally reprehensible situation that should be rectified.
